intro: Salaxis aristata, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Salaxis aristata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
